Articles.Content:
After the Successes of Titan and Colossus the Kerbals put everything they had into another design. Code named "Zenith" it was to rise above ever other attempt that preceded it. Again sticking to the plan of very few parts, re-usability and in transit re-configuration. With only 80 parts and no orbital construction required, the Zenith launched an entire interplanetary craft in style.

With less than 45 parts it transits to Duna.

With some "persistence" is lands and deploys it's rover.

Return is easy, safe and with plenty of spare fuel... they said.

But not to worry, Omega is undergoing tests as we speak!

Thanks. The docking ports mean you can use it as a tug, or take more fuel/sections with you too. Just not in a single launch as above.

The next version will have 4 engines and hopefully no additional part count.

Will upload the craft file if anyone is interested.
